meanings.definition: A person who is unable to read or write.
meanings.sent1: The analphabet struggled to understand the words in the book.
meanings.sent2: The teacher helped the analphabet learn the alphabet.
meanings.sent3: The analphabet tried to write a letter but ended up drawing a picture instead.
meanings.sent4: In a world of books, he felt like an analphabet lost in a sea of words.
meanings.sent5: The analphabet's world was silent, devoid of the stories hidden in books.

meanings.sent1: She felt embarrassed being the only analphabet in the class.
meanings.sent2: The analphabet struggled to fill out the form at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent3: The analphabet joked that they could only read emojis.
meanings.sent4: In a digital age, he felt like an analphabet in a world of code.
meanings.sent5: The analphabet longed to unlock the secrets of the written word.
